summary: An Ordinance repealing Ordinance No. 12409, entitled "An Ordinance providing for the improvement of Thirty-eighth Avenue North, from the south margin of East Prospect Street to the north margin of East Blaine Street, and East Highland Drive from Thirty-eighth Avenue North to the east margin of Thirty-ninth Avenue North, all in the City of Seattle, by grading and curbing the same, in accordance with Resolution of the City Council No. 479, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by an act of the Legislature of the State of Washington, entitled "An act authorizing the issuance and sale of bonds by cities, to pay for local improvements, providing for the payment thereof, and declaring an emergency, approved March 14, 1899, and Ordinance No. 5693 of said city, approved December 6, 1899."
